resource.title: Item Pricing
resource.notfound: Try a short phrase like 'staff power' or 'potion grow'

dtlresource.title: Downtime Log
dtlresource.help: You can spend your downtime in various ways.
dtlresource.notfound: specify a an activity like 'craft' or 'research'

learn.name: Training (Tool, Weapon or Language)
learn.help:
PCs can spend downtime training to gain proficiency in tools and languages. You must have a suitable instructor willing to provide the instruction. NPCs only train if the location pin says they offer training. PC instructors can only offer instruction in the tools and languages they are already proficient in.

PCs must spend 10 workweeks and 250 gold to train a single tool or language proficiency, unless stated otherwise in a location pin. All PCs involved in the training sessions must spend their downtime and gold within 24 hours.
learn.example:
Learning **Woodcarver's tools** from @Player character Bob:
`<alias> training @Player Bob woodcarver`

Learning **Deep Speech** from an NPC called Jim:
`<alias> learn "deep speech" npc Jim`

teach.name: Instructing (Tool, Weapon Language)
teach.help:
Both PCs and NPCs can serve as instructors. NPCs only train if the location pin says they offer training. PC instructors can only offer instruction in the tools and languages they are already proficient in.

PC instructors must spend 10 workweeks to give instruction. One PC instructor can train more than one student at the same time for tool or language, but all PCs involved in the training sessions must spend their downtime and gold within 24 hours.
teach.example:
Teaching **Woodcarver's tools** to @Player character Alice:
`<alias> teach @Player Alice woodcarver`

Instructing **Deep Speech** to Jim:
`<alias> instruct "deep speech" @Player Jim`

research.name: Researching a Magic Item Formula
research.help: A magic item Formula lists the Exotic Component(s) required to craft the magic item. Once a Formula is obtained, PCs can go on adventures to collect the required Exotic Components.
research.example:
Research **Cloak of Protection** (Uncommon):
`<alias> research cloak of protection`

Find formula for **Staff of Power** (Very Rare):`<alias> formula staff power`

component.name: Collecting a Exotic Component
component.help: Once a formula for a magic item has been found or researched, you can begin collection of the exotic components required to craft the item.

craft.name: Crafting (Mundane or Magical Item)
craft.help:
PCs can spend downtime to craft mundane or magic items. PCs can only craft magic items appropriate for their tier. Note: Items with an asterisk in the Discerning Merchant guide are not eligible for Magic Item Crafting.

You must have already researched the fomula for a magic item and collected the components required.
craft.example:
Craft **Cloak of Protection** (Uncommon):
`<alias> craft cloak of protection`

Craft **Staff of Power** (Very Rare):
`<alias> make staff power`

Craft **Mundane Items** totalling 400gp:
`<alias> craft mundane 400 shields, scale mail and longswords for 5 skeletons`

misc.name: Miscellaneous Downtime
misc.help:
Use this for recording other downtime activities such as studying or using items like manuals, repeated casting or long-duration spells.

**Command**: `<alias> misc <weeks spent> <description of task>`
misc.example:
A **Manual of Bodily Health** (48 hours study over 6 days or less):
`<alias> misc 1 study manual of health`

A **Manual of the Golems**, 120 workdays for an Iron Golem:
`<alias> misc 24 studying golem manual for iron golem`

Casting a spell daily to make it Permanent (52 weeks):
`<alias> misc 52 casting mordenkainen's private sanctum in briarwood`

Robe of Useful Items.t:
This robe has cloth patches of various shapes and colors covering it. While wearing the robe, you can use an action to detach one of the patches, causing it to become the object or creature it represents. Once the last patch is removed, the robe becomes an ordinary garment.
The GM chooses the patches or determines them randomly.
